description: Generated by Yang2JsonSchema (1.12.0-SNAPSHOT 2019-10-09 17:32:48 CEST) on Oct 11, 2019 7:33:02 AM from Yang module: ericsson-nrf (1.0.12), with features: [], and with deviations/extensions: []
title: ericsson-nrf

geo-red.description: Additional options to control NRF service availability status when Geographical Redundancy function encounters external faults. The Geographical Redundancy function itself has to be setup manually according to user guide.

keep-management-service.description: NRF NFManagement Service keeps handling service requests even if Geographical Redundancy function detects that this NRF leaves the redundancy configuration. This applies also for provisioning service.

keep-discovery-service.description: NRF NFDiscovery Service keeps handling service requests even if Geographical Redundancy function detects that this NRF leaves the redundancy configuration.

witness-nf.description: Witness NF used to assist NRF Geographical Redundancy function to select leading NRF.

identity-type.description: To specify the identity type of the witness NF

identity-value.description: To specify the fqdn or nfInstanceId of the witness NF

plmn-nrf.description: NRF is configured as PLMN NRF.

mode.description: In NRF layered deployment, the PLMN NRF mode to handle discovery or subscription.

region-nrf.description: NRF is configured as region NRF.

next-hop.description: The same/upper layer NRFs, towards which region NRF registers itself and forwards discovery request in case no match result within region itself.

mode.description: Traffic load balance mode among different NRFs in the same pool.

pool.description: NRFs in each pool belong to a geographical redundancy system.

id.description: Unique ID represents the pool of NRFs.

layer.description: NRF pool is in the same layer or upper layer.

ipv4-address.description: IPv4 address(es) of the the NRF.

ipv6-address.description: IPv6 address(es) of the the NRF.

priority.description: Priority of this NRF compared to the set of NRF in redundancy mode;lower values indicate a higher priority If priority is also present in the service parameters, those will have precedence over this value.

capacity.description: Static capacity information in the range of 0-65535, expressed as a weight relative to other NRF, If priority is also present in the service parameters, those will have precedence over this value.

id.description: Unique ID represents the NRF service.

version.description: Versions of the service instance to be used in the URI for accessing the API.

ip-endpoint.description: IP address(es) and port information where the service is listening for incoming service requests.

priority.description: Priority to be used for NF Service selection.

capacity.description: Static capacity information in the range of 0-65535, expressed as a weight relative to other services of the same type.

api-prefix.description: Optional path segment(s) used to construct the {apiRoot} variable of the different API URIs.

supported-features.description: Supported Features of the NF Service instance.

instance-id.description: Unique ID of the service instance within the NF Instance.

version.description: The API versions supported by the NF Service and if available, the corresponding retirement date of the NF Service.

fqdn.description: FQDN of the NF Service Instance.

inter-plmn-fqdn.description: If the NF service needs to be discoverable by other NFs in a different PLMN, then an FQDN that is used for inter PLMN routing as specified in 3GPP TS 23.003 may be registered with the NRF.

ip-endpoint.description: IP addresses and port information of the Network Function (including IPv4 and/or IPv6 address) where the service is listening for incoming service requests.

api-prefix.description: Optional path segment used to construct the {apiRoot} variable of the different API URIs, as described in 3GPP TS 29.501

default-notification-subscription.description: Notification endpoints for different notification types.

allowed-plmn.description: PLMNs allowed to access the service instance. The absence of this attribute indicates that any PLMN is allowed to access the service instance. When included, the allowedPlmns attribute needs not include the PLMN IDs registered in the plmnList attribute of the NF Profile, i.e. the PLMN IDs registered in the NF Profile shall be considered to be allowed to access the service instance.

allowed-nf-type.description: Type of the NFs allowed to access the service instance. The absence of this attribute indicates that any NF type is allowed to access the service instance.

allowed-nf-domain.description: Pattern (regular expression according to the ECMA-262 dialect) representing the NF domain names allowed to access the service instance. The absence of this attribute indicates that any NF domain is allowed to access the service instance.

allowed-nssai.description: S-NSSAI of the allowed slices to access the service instance. The absence of this attribute indicates that any slice is allowed to access the service instance.

priority.description: Priority (relative to other services of the same type) in the range of 0-65535 to be used for NF Service selection; lower values indicate a higher priority.

capacity.description: Static capacity information in the range of 0-65535, expressed as a weight relative to other services of the same type.

recovery-time.description: Timestamp when the NF service was (re)started.

supported-features.description: Supported Features of the NF Service instance.

instance-id.description: Unique identity of the NF Instance.

requested-status.description: Administrative status requested to be set in registration process at NRF. When set to \"registered\" or \"suspended\", that shall be the value of the NFStatus parameter in the registration/update request towards NRF. When set to \"deregistered\", the Network Function's registration profile data shall be deleted from NRF.

requested-heartbeat-timer.description: Time in seconds expected between 2 consecutive heart-beat messages from an NF Instance to the NRF, to be included in the registration request.

nsi.description: NSI identities of the Network Function.

inter-plmn-fqdn.description: If the NF needs to be discoverable by other NFs in a different PLMN, then an FQDN that is used for inter PLMN routing as specified in 3GPP TS 23.003 needs to be registered with the NRF.

ipv4-address.description: IPv4 addresses of the Network Function.

ipv6-address.description: IPv6 addresses of the Network Function.

allowed-plmn.description: PLMNs allowed to access the NF instance.

allowed-nf-type.description: Type of the NFs allowed to access the NF instance.

allowed-nf-domain.description: Pattern (regular expression according to the ECMA-262 dialect) representing the NF domain names allowed to access the NF instance.

allowed-nssai.description: S-NSSAI of the allowed slices to access the NF instance.

priority.description: Priority (relative to other NFs of the same type) in the range of 0-65535, to be used for NF selection; lower values indicate a higher priority. If priority is also present in the nfServiceList parameters, those will have precedence over this value.

capacity.description: Static capacity information in the range of 0-65535, expressed as a weight relative to other NF instances of the same type; if capacity is also present in the nfServiceList parameters, those will have precedence over this value.

locality.description: Operator defined information about the location of the NF instance.

service-persistence.description: If present, and set to true, it indicates that the different service instances of a same NF Service in this NF instance, supporting a same API version, are capable to persist their resource state in shared storage and therefore these resources are available after a new NF service instance supporting the same API version is selected by a NF Service Consumer.

default.description: Default NF heartbeat timer in seconds that the NRF shall be contacted.

default-per-nftype.description: Default NF heartbeat timer in seconds per NF type that the NRF shall be contacted.

value.description: NF heartbeat value in seconds per NF type

grace-period.description: Extra time in seconds that NRF will wait before NRF change one NF's status to SUSPENDED. If one NF has not updated its profile for heartbeat timer interval plus heartbeat-grace-period, NRF will change the status of the NF to SUSPENDED and consider that the NF and its services can no longer be discovered by other NFs via the NFDiscovery service.

subscription-expired-time.description: NF subscription expiration in seconds, NRF will consider one subscription invalid after the time interval.

traffic-rate-limit-per-instance.description: NRF management traffic rate limit per NF instance per second for status code 429 too many requests.

response-cache-time.description: Time period for caching discovery result by NF Service Consumer.

enabled.description: Indicate whether enable local cache when hierarchical NRFs are deployed. When enabled, NRF discovery caches NF Profiles from discovery result from other NRF.

timeout.description: Time period for caching local cache in seconds.

capacity.description: Maximum number of local cache records.

redirection-url.description: Overload redirection url only valid when overload redirection mode equal to manual.

fqdn.description: FQDN of the NF where the service is hosted.

allowed-subscription-to-all-nfs.description: Policy for subscriptions to all NFs without subscrCond in SubscriptionData. Set allowed-nf-type alone, or set it together with allowed-nf-domains to configure the subscription policy for the NFs which are allowed to subscribe to all NFs. By default, NRF rejects subscriptions to all NFs.

allowed-nf-type.description: The type of NF which is allowed to subscribe to all NFs.

allowed-nf-domains.description: Pattern(regular expression) representing the NF domain names allowed to subscribe to all NFs. If present, NRF allows those subscriptions whose reqNfFqdn matches the defined pattern to subscribe to all NFs.

sbi-message-priority-policy.description: Range definition of priority groups (high, medium, low), by default, high:(0..7) medium:(8..15) low:(16..31).

priority-group-medium-start.description: Value of priority policy group medium start.

priority-group-low-start.description: Value of priority policy group low start.
